Erotica is no longer taboo for some Mala.description: It is a rainy, cool day outside. But inside the hall at a trendy restaurant in Kochi, the atmosphere is heating up with talk of sex. It is a poetry evening, called Un-taboo, and a mixed crowd is talking about their bodies, love, loss, sexuality and abuse. “’Steady girl, take it slow’,” starts Sumi Thomas, as she reads her poem on lovemaking. “... ‘A little part of me laughs at the nerd that I am, the rest of me is burning with desire and cares not for correctness.’” Even if it is a small group which has pre-registered for the event, it is stunning to see that the wife and mother of two, albeit a media professional, doesn’t mince or hold back her words and builds up her poem to a sexual and emotional crescendo. And a few others follow suit, attracting applause and drawn breaths in a couple of cases with the boldness of their words. Are women in conservative Kerala okay with expressing their feelings on their bodies and about sex openly? Sumi says, “I know this poem is not exactly Kamala Das, but I posted it online because I felt I had to let out my voice for myself and my daughters.” Anna Varghese Puthuran, a High Court lawyer who has worked with an NGO that works with building a new life for sexually abused women and children, says, “I feel women need to reclaim spaces. This conversation has to be had. For how long can we run away from topics like this? I was always told off for writing explicitly and was told to write about pretty things, but it is important to go back to your authentic self whatever that might be. And maybe people are also more ready to accept women’s voices now.” And if they are not, don’t feel bogged down by judgment, the women say. Lola hails from Kumbalam, a village on the backwaters of Kochi, but is today a globe-trotting artist. An exhibition she is planning this year in Kochi has vagina as its theme. The artist, who “loves to draw and take pictures of nudes”, says the worst comments come from people close to her family, but she gets about 30 messages every day from strangers admiring her work. But, even for an artist who posts pictures of herself in very revealing clothes on social media, there is a self-monitoring that takes place. “Some days I’m brave and some days I’m not, but some posts can be an inspiration for others. If I’m craving to do this so much, other women must be too; so why restrict their voices?” she asks. As for her exhibition, she says Kochi is ready for it, because “it’s not sexual, it’s art”.  Sumi, who is now writing a short story ‘with a lot of erotic elements’, says, “If people judge my character based on what I write, it does not matter to me. All writing comes from some connection you feel to the stories that you are telling. I will write what I feel like writing.” Lidiya Prasad, a copywriter, who moved to Kochi from Bengaluru, felt life here would be staid and culturally low-key, so she was happy to take part in an earlier adult poetry session. She recently published a book of her “very explicit and more low-key” poems, and says, “It is not about rebelling, but people have to think of women beyond the good-girl and virgin labels. But funnily enough, though there are poems in my book which deals with other subjects, people only want to talk about the erotic stuff.”  Women feel that there are inevitably several men who felt their words were an “invitation to casual sex”. “Initially, I used to cry thinking I invited this behaviour from men, but now I’ve learnt that it is a problem they must deal with,” says Lidiya.  Their families are a mix of understanding, encouraging and embarrassed. While the women are sometimes conscious that they must not post things that would embarrass their families, Anna says, “Our relationships with our family get more mature as we age, and they become more respectful of our voice.”  Jayakrishnan Pillai, whose media company organised the Un-taboo event, which was advertised on social media, says he received a call from an elderly man in Kozhikode congratulating them for holding the event, which he said was much-needed in our society. “This poetry event was a solution to the whole idea that women cannot express themselves freely on social media without attracting sexual and annoying comments from people. This was a chance to meet like-minded people and share thoughts without being questioned,” he says. Apart from social media blurring the borders on what privacy mean, even a movement like the Kudumbashree has given women the opportunity to be outgoing, says activist Rekha Raj. She explains that at gender workshops, she meets lots of youngsters who question why their privacy is curtailed and just hang out and do the things they want to. “Even the conversations in our homes are changing and families are discussing the idea of sexuality, thanks to the issues and the calls for rights in the queer movement. This is a positive change; it is probably reflecting quite slowly in society, but it is happening,” she says. In Video:Malayali women's bold artDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Project to ensure people\u2019s role in.description: KOCHI: As part of the Indo-German bilateral cooperation, the ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) and the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) India are jointly implementing Sustainable Urban Development – Smart Cities (SUD-SC) project. The objective of the project is to support sustainable development in various Indian cities. As part of the process, Kochi municipal corporation with the support of GIZ, organized ‘Ente Kochi’ symposium here on Monday. This is to facilitate implementation of sustainable project through a holistic and integrated approach. ‘Ente Kochi’, a participatory planning initiative, involved local residents in participatory processes through an interactive public exhibition set up at the Folklore Cultural Theatre at Fort Kochi. The exhibition had been organized parallel to the Kochi-Muziris Biennale in March. ‘Ente Kochi’ participatory process also spread through the city with a series of neighbourhood workshops at different locations. These neighbourhood consultations, known as ‘Urban Typhoon’ workshops, were held at Kaloor, Edakochi, Elamkulam, Market Canal and Mattancherry in June. These were led by Mumbai-based Urbz, an experimental action and research collective, which specializes in participatory planning and designing, and has experience working in India and other international locations. At the same time, there are opinions that this programme does not have much significance in states like Kerala. “We have people’s planning programme which ensures people’s participation in designing and implementation of development projects in an effective manner. So, the initiative by GIZ has nothing more to do,” said an official with the Kochi corporation said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Slain cop\u2019s mom, son say Ajas threa.description: ALAPPUZHA: The body of civil police officer Soumya Pushpakaran, who was brutally murdered, was handed over to her kin after completing legal and medical examinations at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital at 2pm on Sunday. It has been shifted to the morgue of a private hospital at her native place, Oachira in Kollam. Cremation would take place after the arrival of her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, on Tuesday, said police. Soumya , who was working at Vallikunnam police station, was hacked and set ablaze by N A Ajas (33), a civil police officer attached to Aluva traffic police station, on Saturday near her home at Thekkemuri in Vallikunnam grama panchayat. Soumya was working at Vallikunnam police stationAjas, who sustained over 40% burns, has been admitted to Alappuzha Medical College Hospital. Though police arrived at the hospital with magistrate to record his on Saturday night, he was not able to speak. The police have not registered his arrest still Sunday evening. Meanwhile, Soumya’s mother Indira and elder son Rishikesh told media that Ajas had threatened and attacked her many times.  “Amma (Soumya) had told me if anything happens to her, I should tell police that Ajas is responsible. She told me that the man had threatened her several times over phone. My father is unaware of these incidents,’’ Rishikesh said. According to Indira, “Ajas killed her after she turned down his marriage proposal. He had threatened to kill her and her husband many times. He had beaten her up with shoes. When I had offered to interfere, she said it might create more trouble. She had also informed Vallikunnam sub-inspector about the issue three months ago.” However, Vallikunnam sub-inspector Shaiju Ebrahim said he was not informed. He added that Indira herself told him on Sunday that they did not inform police due to fear. He said Sowmya had borrowed Rs 1.25 lakh from Ajas. When she returned the money, Ajas did not accept it and demanded to marry him. She transferred the money to his account. But he sent it back to her account. Following this, Sowmya and Indira asked him to collect the money in person at KSRTC bus station, Ernakulam in May. Though he came to meet them, he refused to take the money back and dropped the duo at Clappana. When things started going out of hands, Sowmya blocked his number. But Ajas continued to stalk her from other numbers. Indira, too, had requested Ajas not to disturb her daughter, the officer said. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Her husband was home a month ago on vacation. Apart from Rishikesh (Class VII), the couple has another son, Adhisesh (Class V) and a three-and-a-half-year-old daughter, Ridhika. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Kochi: Next, water transport to go solar.description: KOCHI: After solar-power revolutionized operations of the Cochin International Airport Limited (Cial), it is now the turn of the state water transport department (SWTD) to go eco-friendly with green energy. With the success of the first solar passenger boat, the water transport department is all set to launch three more boats in the coming months. “Aditya, our first solar boat has been running successfully for the last two years and not a trip has been cancelled. The fuel costs have just been Rs 200-280 for electricity and we have saved about Rs 48 lakhs on diesel,” said SWTD director Shaji Nair. Three of the boats including a cruise-liner will become operational in the next few months. The tendering process for the construction of another three boats will begin by the end of this year. Nair said that in contrast to the huge criticism and pressure that the department faced for venturing into solar-powered boats, Aditya is drawing international attention too. “We had senior officials from almost 40 countries visiting us recently to travel in the boat. They were part of the International solar alliance (ISA) and had come to look at the boat so that it could be replicated and customized in their countries,” he said. Of the two new boats under construction at NavAlt, one will be a return boat in the Vaikkom- Thavanakadavu route while the other would be in the Panavally-Thiruvananthapuram route. The cruise-liner will be an air-conditioned, double-decker boat and deployed in Alappuzha for ‘See Kuttanad’ programme. These boats will be powered by a hybrid battery. “During day time, we will use solar power and at night battery power,” Nair said. The first solar boat, Aditya, has completed two years of service in January. During the period, the boat carried 6, 00,000 passengers and travelled around 38,000 km without a single drop of fuel thereby saving 58,000 litres of diesel. This saved Rs 45 lakhs in diesel and maintenance cost during the period. Sandith Thandasherry, the man behind India’s first solar-powered ferry and CEO of NavAlt Solar and Electric Boats said that all countries in the tropical area were interested in the solar boats and the delegation which visited Aditya was in discussions with his company for manufacturing solar boats. He said that the ISA had offered to try to aggregate the combined demand the requirement of the countries as Aditya was a successful model of a public transport with a capacity of carrying 100 passengers. The Inland Waterways Authority of India has also evinced interest in running solar boats in the Ganga and Yamuna. “They have called for tenders for the Yamuna taxi and have kept very high technical standards,” Sandith said. Meanwhile, Kochi Metro’s water project is already looking at solar boats. Also, Cochin International Airport Limited (CIAL) is also looking at a solar-powered boat which is intended to be operated in the inland waterways. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

In a recent event related to the formation of a badminton team, actors Jayaram, Narain, Parvathy Nambiar and Rajeev Pillai were seen joining in with full spirits, all dressed in black. Three held with hashish oil brought for.description: KOCHI: Three youths were arrested by the city shadow police after seizing several bottles of hashish oil from them on Tuesday. The accused were identified as Sharun (23) and Sarath (22) who are siblings, and Pranav (20), all hailing from Mulavukad. According to police, they were nabbed from near Container Terminal Road on their arrival from Bengaluru from where they reportedly brought the hashish oil kept in several bottles. “The drug was meant for supplying to a rave party to be held at a private resort in the city on Saturday,” said police. “The tip-off about the party was received after we arrested a youngster last week who was waiting for drug delivery at High Court Junction. We later made him lure out the suppliers by sealing a deal and sent them a map of the location through WhatsApp for exchange of drugs. The accused believed it and got trapped,” said police. Police have launched a probe against the resort owners. Ganja peddler arrested The special squad of Ernakulam excise division arrested a 34-year-old man on charges of possession and sale of ganja on Tuesday. The sleuths seized more than 2kg of ganja from the accused who was identified as Azad (34) of Kuttamasserry at Aluva West. According to excise officials, he was arrested based on the information provided by the top narcotic secret group led by inspector B Suresh. The officials said the accused left his job abroad recently and started selling drugs. They traced him from the details collected from a high school student, who was brought to the Vimukthi counselling centre at excise zonal office at Kacheripady by his parents when they found ganja in his schoolbag. \nPearle looked nothing less than a diva.description: When a duo as dynamic as Adil Ibrahim and Pearle Maaney met recently in the city, the celebratory mood that the chirpy pair set in was altogether different. Amid the cheerful aura of festivities, they also had their own reasons to celebrate over a delicious ‘kappa and fish curry’.  While Adil looked simplistic, Pearle looked nothing less than a diva in her gown. Singer-composer Ramesh Narayanan made his presence felt along with his daughter Madhusree Narayanan, who looked ravishing in a kalamkari gown, aptly matched by a black overcoat. Apartment owners allege 1996 CRZ map was.description: KOCHI: Residents of Alfa Serene apartment, facing the threat of demolition, have said that the 1996 Coastal Zone Mapping (CZMP), on the basis of which the property in which they reside has been deemed illegal, was crude, inaccurate and full of errors. The Supreme Court had on May 8 ordered the demolition of the four high rises at Maradu, including Alfa Serene, citing the violation of coastal regulation zone (CRZ) norms. Addressing a news meet here, Alfa Serene Apartment Owners’ Association said the 1996 map was so crude that it was difficult to identify a place. “It is unlike the map prepared in 2012 by Maradu municipality, in which the building and CR zones can be clearly identified by the survey numbers,” said association president Rasheed Usman. The press conference was also attended by association secretary Sen Eapen and Sooraj Krishna, a resident. “It mentioned that the area comes under CRZ-3, which is defined as relatively undisturbed rural area. But the area in which the apartment is located is more developed than some of the Cochin corporation areas,” said Krishna. “In 2003 itself the Kerala high court had said that the 1996 map is basic and so illegible that no definite conclusions can be made with such mapping,” he said. “What is the minimum guarantee for people like us? We relied on the approval documents given to us by the builder and the due diligence done by the banks who have given loans. The sub-registrar office collected the stamp duty paid by us, the municipality collected building tax from us, the village office collected land tax from us, KSEB is collecting charges for electricity, oil companies are collecting LPG charges, Kerala Water Authority is collecting water charges from us. So, we have been living in this community as legitimate owners,” said Krishna. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Government to take a call based on Sreed.description: KOCHI: Heeding to the state government’s request to help fix the issues related to Palarivattom flyover, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation’s (DMRC) principal adviser E Sreedharan inspected the flyover on Monday. Sreedharan, along with a team of experts from Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs) Kanpur and Madras, visited the flyover around 8am and inspected the restoration works. The flyover has been closed for traffic for more than a month. Though Sreedharan spent around one and a half hours at the flyover inspecting the pillars, girders and the cracks, he refused to openly speak about the defects. According to DMRC sources, he is expected to submit an inspection report directly to the state government in the coming days based on which the state government will take a call on whether the flyover should be restored or demolished. Sreedharan was roped in for the inspection by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan after a meeting with PWD minister G Sudharkaran last week. Sreedharan, who started the inspection from the northern end of the flyover, walked beneath the 750m flyover and conducted a detailed inspection of each pillar and girder. Alaga Sundara Murthy, professor of structural engineering laboratory at the department of civil engineering at IIT-Madras, and Mahesh Tandon from IIT-Kanpur accompanied him through the inspection. Officials from PWD, roads and bridges development corporation of Kerala limited (RBDCK) and Kitco Ltd were also present. Murthy explained to Sreedharan the findings by the IIT-Madras team, which had earlier conducted a study of the flyover and found structural flaws. He showed him the cracks on the pillars and girders which have been posing threat to the bridge’s stability. The reinforcement and restoration works of the flyover were also monitored by the team. The team reportedly raised concerns about the severe cracks on the girders. After the inspection beneath the bridge, the team went to the top of the bridge where they spent around 15 minutes to inspect the potholes and cracks. After this, Sreedharan concluded the inspection and returned to DMRC office where an internal meeting of all parties involved in the flyover construction was held. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Soumya murder: Magistrate records statem.description: ALAPPUZHA: Alappuzha judicial first class magistrate has recorded the statement of civil police officer (CPO) N A Ajas, who brutally murdered woman CPO Soumya Pushpakaran by setting her ablaze. The magistrate recorded his statement after Ajas told the doctor that he can speak to the magistrate on Sunday. “Ajas is undergoing treatment at Alappuzha Medical College Hospital and his burn injuries are serious. The burn injuries have affected the functioning of kidneys. The doctors started dialysis on Monday,” police said. However, Vallikunnam police are yet to register his arrest. According to police sources, Ajas said that he killed Soumya after she refused to marry him and she kept a distance from him. Meanwhile, Soumya’s relatives said that her cremation will be held by Wednesday noon. Her body is kept in the morgue of a private hospital at her native place at Oachira in Kollam. Her husband Sajeev, who is working in Libya, will reach home by Wednesday morning, a relative said. However, another relative of Soumya said that some MGNREGA workers who were at work near Soumya’s home had told them that it was not just Ajas in the car. “They told us that one more person was inside the car and he ran away when Ajas alighted from the vehicle. We have informed police about this and the police said that they need to check the CCTV footage to confirm it,” he said. Ajas, who was waiting in a rented car, in front of Soumya’s home, rammed her scooter and knocked her down on Saturday. Seeing Ajas alight from the car, Soumya tried to flee but Ajas attacked her with a sword. Soumya managed to run to a neighbour’s house after crossing a small canal. Ajas chased her, poured petrol over her body and set her on fire using a cigarette lighter. Soumya was the younger daughter of Pushpakaran and Indira of Clappana in Kollam. Pushpakaran, 67, suffered stroke four years ago and is now not able to go for work. Indira, a tailor by profession, met the study expenses of Soumya, a graduate, and her elder sister. Soumya’s elder sister and family live in Abu Dhabi. Soumya had joined Kerala Police in 2014. She was trained under Ajas for around three months. They went on to become friends through social media, said her friends. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Sachin Warrier-Pooja wedding reception t.description: Singer-music composer Sachin Warrier recently got married to Pooja in Thrissur, and the wedding was followed by a fun-filled reception in Kochi on June 16. While Sachin wore a white shirt with suspenders, Pooja looked very cute in a short, baby pink dress. Unlike other wedding receptions, the couple planted a sapling, instead of cutting the cake, and their family and friends made sure that everything about the function was different. As it also happened to be Father’s Day, the newlyweds’ dads took centre stage, and Sachin and Pooja together celebrated their real life heroes. It was followed by a lot of interesting games, which kept the guests entertained. Among those who made their presence felt were actor Vineeth Sreenivasan with wife Divya and their munchkin, singer Jyotsna, Resmi Sateesh, and Anandam fame director Ganesh Raj. Shukkoor Murder: Kerala HC transfers tri.description: KOCHI: The Kerala high court has ordered for transferring the trial in the case over murder of Muslim League worker Abdul Shukkoor to the CBI special court in Ernakulam. A petition filed by CBI seeking transfer of trial and further proceedings to the special court here was considered by the high court. Transferring of the case pending before Thalassery sessions court is needed so that the additional report filed in the case can also be considered by the trial court, CBI had argued. CBI approached the high court after the Thalassery court declined to accept its report and asked it to approach the special court in Ernakulam. The high court had earlier stayed further proceedings in the case at Thalassery sessions court. It was on February 20, 2012 that Shukkoor was murdered in broad daylight after holding him hostage at Ariyil near Pattuvam in Kannur. This was allegedly in retaliation of workers of Muslim League’s youth wing blocking vehicles of CPM leaders. In the chargesheet filed in February this year, CBI had named CPM leaders P Jayarajan and TV Rajesh to be involved in the conspiracy. A single bench of the high court had in February 2016 ordered CBI to conduct a further investigation in the case after considering a plea by the victim’s mother. The court had pointed out that all those who were with the leaders were named as accused on conspiracy charge but they have been avoided. They were instead booked for a lighter offence, of not trying to prevent the murder after getting information about the conspiracy, the single bench had stated. Jayarajan and Rajesh had approached a division bench challenging the single bench’s judgment but the order for further investigation was confirmed in February 2017. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12.
